CANDIDATE 		Abeer Abu Diab
PERSONAL DETAILS
Location:		UAE – Dubai
QUALIFICATIONS
Masters in People Management & Development Middlesex University- UAE – April 2021
Diploma in Human Resources Practice- CIPD/ Level 7
Bachelor of Business Administration - Bir Zeit University– Palestine - June 2007
CAREER SUMMARY
Feb 2016 to date Johnson & Johnson – Middles East, Africa & Turkey
Position: HR Services Leader – GCC & HR Business Partner ME (Grow Assignment)
Feb 2022- Present- HR Business Partner ME (Grow Assignment):
Support the HR Director in developing and driving the HR strategies that are aligned with the organization goals. Co-drive HR priorities with the board members.
Drive a strong culture through application of organizational development interventions, coaching and business partnership. CANDIDATE 		Abeer Abu Diab
PERSONAL DETAILS
Location:		UAE – Dubai
QUALIFICATIONS
Masters in People Management & Development Middlesex University- UAE – April 2021
Diploma in Human Resources Practice- CIPD/ Level 7
Bachelor of Business Administration - Bir Zeit University– Palestine - June 2007
CAREER SUMMARY
Feb 2016 to date Johnson & Johnson – Middles East, Africa & Turkey
Position: HR Services Leader – GCC & HR Business Partner ME (Grow Assignment)
Feb 2022- Present- HR Business Partner ME (Grow Assignment):
Support the HR Director in developing and driving the HR strategies that are aligned with the organization goals. Co-drive HR priorities with the board members.
Drive a strong culture through application of organizational development interventions, coaching and business partnership.
Work collaboratively with People leaders to identify talents and develop their talent plan to ensure building strong calibers.
Develop country talent strategy in partnership with stakeholders to grow diverse leadership talent.
Ensure implementation of global HR strategy in their area of scope to ensure alignment with global priorities. Provide insight into the development of global strategy.
Partner with leadership to identify business needs and challenges and provide appropriate HR solutions that are aligned with business direction, to ensure effective talent management and to improve individual and organizational performance and engagement.
Use all available HR data to ensure HR analytics supports all reporting, action planning and decision making and put forward recommendations for change.
Mar 2020- Present: HR Services Leader- GCC
Serve as a trusted partner to advise and coach employees and managers on all human resources programs and activities.
Work collaboratively with line managers in leading and managing their people by providing inductions, training material and performance management guidance
Partner with COE to ensure coordination of HR strategies and key processes across the organization for seamless implementation
Handle employee relations issues, assess related legal risk and make recommendations to resolve concerns and/or improve morale.
Implement effective strategies to enable the organization to thrive through periods of change, (e.g. restructurings), while promoting cultural understanding and diversity.
Ensure compliance with company policies/ procedures, global guidelines and employment law.
Feb 2016- Feb 2020
Position: HR Specialist- UAE, Egypt, Saudi Arabia
Responsible for ensuring the implementation of HR policies, and continuously improve HR tools, practices and activities, that are compliant with local laws and regulations
Provide advice and counsel to employees on general workplace policies and practices, issues related to their job performance as well as career development and job opportunities.
Partner and engage with HR group specialists to develop and implement HR Initiatives that enable organizational success and maximize employee engagement and motivation at all levels.
Engage with key stakeholders to review delivery of service, plan resource requirements and identify opportunities for improvement
Create and implement effective onboarding and offboarding plans and conduct orientation sessions.
Participate in relevant projects, leading and championing as appropriate.
Responsible for communication and training of all HR policies and programs to employees including new hires.
Projects Handled:
2021- Currently working on an assignment as Regional Training, Change Management and Communication Leader for launching the HR new ways of working in the EMEA remaining markets (28 Countries), guiding local champions on the change management approaches to be implemented in each country, and creating and delivering training to the HR teams on the new tools and processes.
2020- Worked on five months assignment as a Training and CM&C Lead for Nordic countries, Czech Republic and Slovakia. Delivered full training to the team on new processes and HR tools, by creating interactive training material and implemented with hands-on scenarios in order to deliver the goals planned taking into consideration the covid circumstances.

career_advancement: Focus on building core technical skills
Seek mentorship from senior team members
Take on challenging projects to gain experience
